bibl.title: A Postscript about a Wooden Tablet Book .
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists
bibl.author: WHITEHORNE, John

bibl.note: More tablet books were found in 1991/2 at Ismant el-Kharab (ancient Kellis) in Egypt's Dakhleh Oasis. There was also a small archive of papyri and a deposit of over 600 fragments of papyri, from which the text provisionally numbered P. Kellis 63 has been recovered. This private letter (early to mid-A.D. iv) refers to "a well-proportioned 10-page notebook of city quality".
WHITEHORNE John, A Postscript about a Wooden Tablet Book (P. Kellis 63).
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 277-283.
